title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 25 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 25.

questions.question: How old was Amaziah when he began to reign in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty and five years old
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:1 states that Amaziah was twenty and five years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: What was the name of Amaziah's mother?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoaddan
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 25:1, Amaziah's mother was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.

questions.question: Did Amaziah do what was right in the sight of the LORD with a perfect heart?
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:2 says Amaziah did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, but not with a perfect heart.

questions.question: What did Amaziah do to the servants who had killed his father?
questions.correctAnswer: He slew them
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:3 states that Amaziah slew his servants that had killed the king his father.

questions.question: What did Amaziah do regarding the children of the slain servants?
questions.correctAnswer: He spared their children
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:4 explains that Amaziah did not kill the children, but followed the law that fathers shall not die for the children.

questions.question: How many choice men able to fight did Amaziah find in Judah and Benjamin?
questions.correctAnswer: Three hundred thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:5 mentions that Amaziah found three hundred thousand choice men able to go forth to war.

questions.question: From where did Amaziah hire one hundred thousand mighty men of valour?
questions.correctAnswer: Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:6 states Amaziah hired one hundred thousand mighty men of valour out of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: The man of God told Amaziah to take the army of Israel with him because the LORD was with Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 25:7, the man of God said the LORD is not with Israel, so Amaziah should not take their army.

questions.question: What did Amaziah do with the army of Israel after the man of God's warning?
questions.correctAnswer: Sent them home
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:10 states Amaziah separated the army that came from Ephraim and sent them home again.

questions.question: How many Edomites did Amaziah kill in the valley of salt?
questions.correctAnswer: Ten thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:11 tells that Amaziah smote ten thousand of the children of Seir in the valley of salt.

questions.question: What did Amaziah do to the other ten thousand Edomites he captured?
options: Cast them down from the top of the rock
questions.correctAnswer: Cast them down from the top of the rock
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 25:12, the children of Judah cast down ten thousand Edomites from the top of a rock, breaking them in pieces.

questions.question: What did the soldiers of the army Amaziah sent back do afterward?
questions.correctAnswer: Attacked cities of Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:13 states that the soldiers sent back fell upon the cities of Judah and smote three thousand of them.

questions.question: Which gods did Amaziah bring and worship after the slaughter of the Edomites?
options: Gods of the children of Seir
questions.correctAnswer: Gods of the children of Seir
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:14 says Amaziah brought the gods of the children of Seir and bowed down before them.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD sent a prophet to Amaziah to warn him because he sought after the gods of Edom.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:15 explains that the LORD sent a prophet to Amaziah to question why he sought after gods who could not save.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Chronicles 25:18: 'The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife: and there passed by a wild ______ that was in Lebanon, and trode down the thistle.'
questions.correctAnswer: beast
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:18 uses the word 'wild beast' to describe what trode down the thistle in Lebanon.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with pride after a recent success. Based on 2 Chronicles 25, what biblical truth about humility would you share?
options: Pride leads to downfall and defeat.
Success is guaranteed when we boast.
questions.correctAnswer: Pride leads to downfall and defeat.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:19-20 teaches that Amaziah's heart was lifted up in pride after defeating the Edomites, which led to his downfall as God allowed him to be defeated because he sought after other gods.

questions.question: How does Amaziah's response to the prophet in 2 Chronicles 25 teach us about obedience and listening to godly counsel?
options: Ignoring godly counsel leads to destruction.
Obedience is optional if the advice is harsh.
Godly counsel should be debated endlessly.
questions.correctAnswer: Ignoring godly counsel leads to destruction.
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 25:15-16, Amaziah rejects the prophet's warning and God’s counsel, resulting in God’s judgment on him, showing the importance of heeding godly advice.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise their faith for worldly gain. What lesson on faithfulness and integrity does Amaziah's story provide?
options: Compromising faith leads to God’s anger and consequences.
questions.correctAnswer: Compromising faith leads to God’s anger and consequences.
questions.explanation: After defeating the Edomites, Amaziah worshipped their gods (2 Chronicles 25:14), which caused God's anger (v. 15) and led to his downfall (v. 20, 22-23), teaching the importance of faithfulness.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 25 illustrate the importance of trusting God's guidance in leadership and decision-making?
options: Trusting God leads to victory and protection.
God’s help is irrelevant in warfare.
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God leads to victory and protection.
questions.explanation: The man of God warned Amaziah not to take Israel’s army because the LORD was not with Israel (2 Chronicles 25:7-8). Amaziah’s failure to fully trust God resulted in defeat (vv. 22-23).

questions.question: What does Amaziah’s treatment of the children of his father's murderers teach about justice and mercy in biblical parenting and leadership?
options: Justice requires punishing each person for their own sin.
Children must always suffer for their parents’ sins.
Forgiveness is never part of justice.
Leaders should punish family members for crimes.
questions.correctAnswer: Justice requires punishing each person for their own sin.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:3-4 shows Amaziah executed the murderers of his father but spared their children, following the Mosaic law that children should not die for their fathers’ sins.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with contentment after seeing others gain more resources. How does Amaziah's story encourage humility and contentment?
options: Being content and trusting God is better than prideful boasting.
More riches always prove God's favor.
Contentment is irrelevant when pursuing power.
questions.correctAnswer: Being content and trusting God is better than prideful boasting.
questions.explanation: Amaziah’s pride after victory led to downfall (2 Chronicles 25:19-20). The narrative encourages humility and trust in God rather than boasting.

questions.question: How does Amaziah’s action of sending back the Israelite mercenaries teach about trust and dependence on God versus human strength?
options: Dependence on God is crucial rather than relying on foreign armies.
God supports any army if paid well.
questions.correctAnswer: Dependence on God is crucial rather than relying on foreign armies.
questions.explanation: The man of God instructed Amaziah not to bring the Israelite army because God was not with them (2 Chronicles 25:7-10). This teaches reliance on God's guidance rather than human might.

questions.question: True or False: Amaziah did everything perfectly right in the sight of the LORD during his reign.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:2 states that Amaziah did what was right in the sight of the LORD, but not with a perfect heart, indicating imperfection in his obedience.

questions.question: What does the conflict between Amaziah and Joash teach about the consequences of pride and disobedience?
options: Pride and disobedience lead to defeat and loss.
questions.correctAnswer: Pride and disobedience lead to defeat and loss.
questions.explanation: Joash warned Amaziah about pride and meddling (2 Chronicles 25:18-19), but Amaziah ignored the warning and was defeated by Israel (vv. 22-23).

questions.question: True or False: Amaziah followed God's law by sparing the children of his father's murderers.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:3-4 emphasizes that Amaziah killed the murderers but spared their children, following the law that children should not be punished for their fathers' sins.

questions.question: When Amaziah faced the decision to keep or send away the Israelite army, what principle about stewardship and trust in God can we learn?
options: Trusting God's provision is better than clinging to worldly payment.
Money should always influence spiritual decisions.
Stewardship means keeping all hired help regardless of God's will.
God cannot provide beyond what we pay for.
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God's provision is better than clinging to worldly payment.
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 25:9-10, Amaziah hesitated over the payment he gave but was reminded by the man of God that the LORD can give much more, highlighting trust over money.

questions.question: How does the example of Amaziah’s downfall teach about perseverance and guarding against temptation?
options: Yielding to temptation leads to spiritual and practical ruin.
Temptation can be ignored without consequence.
Temptation always results in immediate blessings.
questions.correctAnswer: Yielding to temptation leads to spiritual and practical ruin.
questions.explanation: Amaziah’s worship of foreign gods after victory (2 Chronicles 25:14) led to God's anger and his eventual death (vv. 15-17, 27), showing the dangers of giving in to temptation.

questions.question: What does the story of Amaziah casting down captives from the rock teach about the biblical call to love and forgiveness?
options: Harsh vengeance contradicts the biblical call to mercy and forgiveness.
Vengeance is always justified in leadership.
Forgiveness is never required for enemies.
Love and forgiveness apply only to friends.
questions.correctAnswer: Harsh vengeance contradicts the biblical call to mercy and forgiveness.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:12 describes Amaziah’s brutal treatment of captives, which contrasts with biblical principles of mercy and forgiveness taught elsewhere in Scripture.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Amaziah was ____ years old when he began to reign, and he reigned ____ years in Jerusalem.
options: twenty and five; twenty and nine
twenty and nine; twenty and five
questions.correctAnswer: twenty and five; twenty and nine
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:1 states Amaziah was twenty and five years old when he began to reign and reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: How can we apply the lesson about spiritual integrity from Amaziah’s decision to worship the gods of Edom?
options: Compromising spiritual integrity leads to divine judgment.
Worshiping other gods is acceptable if victorious.
questions.correctAnswer: Compromising spiritual integrity leads to divine judgment.
questions.explanation: Amaziah’s worship of foreign gods after victory (2 Chronicles 25:14-15) angered the LORD and led to his judgment, illustrating the importance of spiritual integrity.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 25.

questions.question: At what age did Amaziah begin to reign over Judah, and how long did he reign according to 2 Chronicles 25?
options: Twenty-five years old, reigned twenty-nine years
Thirty years old, reigned fifteen years
Twenty years old, reigned thirty years
Twenty-five years old, reigned fifteen years
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-five years old, reigned twenty-nine years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:1 states that Amaziah was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What was the nature of Amaziah's heart in his service to the LORD as described in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Right but not perfect
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:2 explains that Amaziah did what was right in the sight of the LORD, but not with a perfect heart, indicating partial obedience.

questions.question: Which ancient legal principle did Amaziah follow after killing his father's murderers?
options: Fathers shall not die for the children, nor children for the fathers
An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth
Exile of entire families for crimes
questions.correctAnswer: Fathers shall not die for the children, nor children for the fathers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:4 references the Mosaic law that the fathers shall not die for the children, nor children for the fathers, but every man shall die for his own sin, which Amaziah obeyed.

questions.question: How many choice men able to go to war did Amaziah number in Judah and Benjamin?
questions.correctAnswer: Three hundred thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:5 states that Amaziah numbered three hundred thousand choice men able to handle spear and shield for war.

questions.question: What was Amaziah's response to the man of God’s warning about taking the Israelite army with him?
options: He asked what to do about the hundred talents paid to them
He ignored the warning and took them anyway
He immediately dismissed the Israelite army without question
He sought counsel from the priests instead
questions.correctAnswer: He asked what to do about the hundred talents paid to them
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:9 shows Amaziah questioning the man of God about the payment given to the Israelite army and what should be done about it.

questions.question: What caused the Israelite army to return home in anger after Amaziah sent them away?
options: Their anger was greatly kindled against Judah
They were summoned back by Israel's king
questions.correctAnswer: Their anger was greatly kindled against Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:10 explains that when Amaziah sent the Israelite army away, their anger was greatly kindled against Judah, causing them to return home in great anger.

questions.question: What brutal method did Amaziah's forces use to deal with the surviving Edomites after battle?
options: They cast them down from the top of a rock
They sold them into slavery in Babylon
They exiled them to the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: They cast them down from the top of a rock
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 25:12, the ten thousand surviving Edomites were brought to the top of a rock and cast down so they were broken in pieces.

questions.question: True or False: After the victory over Edom, Amaziah remained faithful to the LORD and did not worship foreign gods.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:14 reveals that after the slaughter of the Edomites, Amaziah brought and bowed down before the gods of the children of Seir, burning incense to them, which angered the LORD.

questions.question: What message did the prophet send by the LORD to Amaziah concerning his worship of Edomite gods?
options: Why have you sought gods that could not deliver their own people from your hand?
You will be blessed if you continue
The gods will protect you in battle
You should build temples for these gods
questions.correctAnswer: Why have you sought gods that could not deliver their own people from your hand?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:15 records the prophet's question to Amaziah, challenging his idolatry by pointing out the impotence of these gods.

questions.question: How did Amaziah respond when the prophet rebuked him about worshiping foreign gods?
options: He accused the prophet of being part of the king's counsel and rebuked him
He repented immediately and ceased worshiping foreign gods
He imprisoned the prophet for blasphemy
questions.correctAnswer: He accused the prophet of being part of the king's counsel and rebuked him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:16 shows Amaziah questioning the prophet's authority and telling him to forbear, indicating resistance to the prophetic word.

questions.question: What metaphor did Joash king of Israel use in his message to Amaziah to warn him against pride and conflict?
options: The thistle in Lebanon sent to the cedar, but a wild beast crushed the thistle
A lion roaring in the forest warns the sheep
The vine cannot contend with the oak
A sparrow challenges the eagle in flight
questions.correctAnswer: The thistle in Lebanon sent to the cedar, but a wild beast crushed the thistle
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:18 recounts Joash's parable comparing Amaziah to a weak thistle challenging the mighty cedar, emphasizing the futility of Amaziah's pride.

questions.question: What was the outcome of the battle between Amaziah king of Judah and Joash king of Israel?
options: Judah was defeated and fled every man to his tent
Judah won a decisive victory and captured Joash
The battle ended in a stalemate
questions.correctAnswer: Judah was defeated and fled every man to his tent
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:22 states that Judah was put to the worse before Israel and they fled every man to his tent, indicating a defeat.

questions.question: What did Joash king of Israel do after capturing Amaziah king of Judah?
options: Broke down a portion of Jerusalem’s wall and took gold, silver, vessels, and hostages
Forgave Amaziah and sent him back to Judah
questions.correctAnswer: Broke down a portion of Jerusalem’s wall and took gold, silver, vessels, and hostages
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:23-24 recounts Joash breaking down the wall from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate and taking valuables and hostages back to Samaria.

questions.question: How did Amaziah’s reign end according to 2 Chronicles 25?
options: He was killed in a conspiracy after fleeing to Lachish
He abdicated the throne and lived in exile
He was captured and exiled by Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He was killed in a conspiracy after fleeing to Lachish
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:27 describes a conspiracy against Amaziah, forcing him to flee to Lachish where he was ultimately killed.

questions.question: Theologically, Amaziah’s failure to fully trust God and his subsequent idolatry foreshadow what recurring biblical theme?
options: The downfall of kings who turn from God and the consequences of idolatry
The ultimate triumph of all kings who fight Israel’s enemies
The importance of military alliances with foreign nations
The permanence of Israelite military strength
questions.correctAnswer: The downfall of kings who turn from God and the consequences of idolatry
questions.explanation: Amaziah’s narrative in 2 Chronicles 25 illustrates the biblical theme where turning to foreign gods leads to divine judgment and downfall, a pattern seen throughout Israel’s history.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: At what age did Amaziah begin to reign, and how long did he reign in Jerusalem?
options: Twenty and five years old, reigned twenty and nine years
Thirty years old, reigned thirty years
Twenty years old, reigned fifteen years
Fifteen years old, reigned twenty years
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty and five years old, reigned twenty and nine years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:1 states Amaziah was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. This aligns with biblical records of kings starting their reigns at various ages (e.g., David in 2 Samuel 5:4-5).

questions.question: How is Amaziah's heart described in relation to his obedience to the LORD?
options: Right in the sight of the LORD but not with a perfect heart
Completely faithful and perfect in heart
questions.correctAnswer: Right in the sight of the LORD but not with a perfect heart
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:2 says Amaziah did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, but not with a perfect heart. This reflects the biblical theme that partial obedience is insufficient (cf. 1 Samuel 15:22; Proverbs 4:23).

questions.question: What action did Amaziah take against the servants who killed his father, the king?
options: He slew the servants who killed his father
He exiled them from the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: He slew the servants who killed his father
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:3 records that Amaziah slew his servants who had killed his father, showing a measure of justice consistent with Mosaic law (Exodus 21:14).

questions.question: What principle from the law of Moses did Amaziah follow regarding the children of his father's killers?
options: The fathers shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die for the fathers
The children must also be punished
Everyone is guilty for their father's sins
questions.correctAnswer: The fathers shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die for the fathers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:4 references the Mosaic law that individuals are responsible for their own sin, not that of their relatives (Deuteronomy 24:16; Ezekiel 18:20).

questions.question: How many choice men able to go to war did Amaziah find in Judah and Benjamin?
questions.correctAnswer: Three hundred thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:5 states Amaziah numbered three hundred thousand choice men from twenty years old and above, illustrating the military organization in Israelite society (Numbers 1:3-4).

questions.question: What did Amaziah do to increase his army's strength from Israel?
options: Hired one hundred thousand mighty men of valour for one hundred talents of silver
questions.correctAnswer: Hired one hundred thousand mighty men of valour for one hundred talents of silver
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:6 describes Amaziah hiring soldiers from Israel, showing reliance on human resources rather than solely on God, which later brought consequences (cf. 2 Kings 13:3).

questions.question: What warning did the man of God give Amaziah about taking the Israelite army with him?
options: The LORD is not with Israel; if you go with them, God will make you fall before the enemy
The LORD commands you to take them
The Israelite army is stronger than Judah's
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is not with Israel; if you go with them, God will make you fall before the enemy
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:7-8 explains the prophet's warning emphasizing God's sovereignty and the futility of trusting in Israel's army, resonating with themes in Judges 7:2 and Psalm 20:7.

questions.question: How did Amaziah respond when the man of God questioned him about the hundred talents paid to the Israelite army?
options: He asked what he should do with the money
He declared the army would stay
questions.correctAnswer: He asked what he should do with the money
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:9 records Amaziah's concern about the money already paid, showing human hesitance to obey God fully, a common biblical motif (Matthew 6:24).

questions.question: What was the consequence of Amaziah sending the hired Israelite soldiers away?
options: Their anger was kindled and they returned home in great anger
They blessed Amaziah and left peacefully
questions.correctAnswer: Their anger was kindled and they returned home in great anger
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:10 shows the soldiers' anger, highlighting the danger of partial obedience and broken agreements, echoing warnings in Proverbs 3:5-6.

questions.question: How did Amaziah treat the children of Seir after defeating them?
options: Carried away ten thousand captive and cast them down from a rock
Showed them mercy and released them
questions.correctAnswer: Carried away ten thousand captive and cast them down from a rock
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:12 describes a brutal act, illustrating the severity of ancient warfare and the consequences of sin and pride (cf. Judges 1:6-7; Deuteronomy 20:13).

questions.question: What sin did Amaziah commit after his victory over the Edomites?
options: He brought and worshipped the gods of the children of Seir
He offered sacrifices only to the LORD
He humbled himself before the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: He brought and worshipped the gods of the children of Seir
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:14 shows Amaziah's idolatry, violating the first commandment (Exodus 20:3) and illustrating how victory can lead to spiritual failure (cf. Judges 8:33).

questions.question: How did the LORD respond to Amaziah's idolatry?
options: Sent a prophet to rebuke him and foretold his destruction
questions.correctAnswer: Sent a prophet to rebuke him and foretold his destruction
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:15-16 records God's judgment through a prophet, consistent with God's holiness and justice (Isaiah 59:2; Ezekiel 18:30-32).

questions.question: What was the outcome when Amaziah challenged Joash king of Israel to face him?
questions.correctAnswer: Judah was defeated and fled
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:22 shows Judah's defeat, illustrating divine judgment against disobedience and pride (cf. Proverbs 16:18; 1 Corinthians 10:12).

questions.question: What did Joash king of Israel do after capturing Amaziah king of Judah?
options: Broke down the wall of Jerusalem and took treasures
questions.correctAnswer: Broke down the wall of Jerusalem and took treasures
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:23-24 describes Joash breaking the city walls and taking treasures, a common consequence of defeat in biblical history (cf. 2 Kings 25:10; Nehemiah 2:17).

questions.question: How did Amaziah's reign end according to this chapter?
options: He was killed after fleeing to Lachish due to a conspiracy
questions.correctAnswer: He was killed after fleeing to Lachish due to a conspiracy
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 25:27-28 records Amaziah's violent death following a conspiracy, illustrating the consequences of turning away from God (cf. Judges 9:22-25; 1 Kings 2:46).
